meanings.definition: The amount of electrical resistance in a circuit, measured in ohms.
meanings.sent1: The ohmage of the wire determines how much it resists the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent2: The technician measured the ohmage of the circuit to ensure proper functioning.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to increase the ohmage of the wires by chewing on them.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like high ohmage, resisting any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The ohmage of the resistor was so high that it glowed red hot under the load.

meanings.definition: The level of opposition to the flow of electric current in a circuit.
meanings.sent1: The high ohmage in the circuit caused the lights to flicker.
meanings.sent2: Electricians use tools to measure the ohmage in different parts of a circuit.
meanings.sent3: The ohmage in the wire seemed to play hide and seek with the current.
meanings.sent4: The ohmage of the old wiring was like a stubborn gatekeeper, blocking the electricity's path.
meanings.sent5: The low ohmage of the new resistor allowed the current to flow smoothly.

meanings.definition: The unit of measurement for electrical resistance.
meanings.sent1: The multimeter displayed the ohmage of the resistor in ohms.
meanings.sent2: Students learned how to calculate ohmage in their physics class.
meanings.sent3: The ohmage on the meter jumped up and down like a playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of ohmage was like a key that unlocked the mysteries of circuits.
meanings.sent5: The precise ohmage measurement ensured the circuit operated within safe limits.
